titleStmt.title: Joshua Tevis to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4235

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
. Louisville, KyOcto 30th '63
Gov. Bramlette
Dear Sir.
I am sure the public good will be promoted by the prompt exercise of executive clemency in the case of Esqr indicted in the .Frank GorinJefferson Circuit Court
It is unnecessary to comment on the character and history of Gorin -- He is proud of his state, and has been ever ready to strike for his county --
You know him well, and as the party aggreived Mr Wood is satisfied, a great state has no reason to prosecute such citizens
I hope you will find it consistent with you duty to interfere --

I am
with great respect
Your obt. servt
Joshua Tevis
